metadata.dc:title: Ramsay Hunt syndrome
metadata.dc:description: Varicella is a highly prevalent disease in childhood, while in adulthood it’s responsible for complications due to its reactivation. Among the most common complications, post-herpetic neuralgia is seen more frequently, followed by ophthalmic zoster, herpetic encephalitis and palsy of cranial and peripheral nerves. We present a patient with hemifacial vesicular lesions, involving the left external auditory canal and oral structures, and peripheral facial paralysis, also known as Ramsay Hunt syndrome (AU)
metadata.dc:creator: Rizzotto Guimarães, M
Appel da Silva, M. Campos
Ferrazza Zaltron, V
Weis, L
